meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 100 drachmae.
meanings.sent1: She measured the flour in minae for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, merchants used minae to weigh precious metals.
meanings.sent3: The baker jokingly said, 'Beware! I will sprinkle minae of sugar on your cake.'
meanings.sent4: Her love for him felt as heavy as a minae of gold.
meanings.sent5: The minae of apples she bought filled her basket to the brim.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: The traveler exchanged his coins for minae to use in the market.
meanings.sent2: People traded goods for minae in the bustling city.
meanings.sent3: He playfully said, 'I'll pay you a minae to tell me a joke.'
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a minae of silver.
meanings.sent5: The minae in his pouch jingled as he walked down the street.

meanings.sent1: The villain's minae echoed through the silent night.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's minae of detention kept the students in line.
meanings.sent3: She teasingly said, 'I'll unleash a minae of tickles on you!'
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, a minae of impending rain.
meanings.sent5: His minae of leaving her made her heart ache.
